message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper proposes a framework for Conversational Recommender Systems (CRS) that involves building predictive models, learning a dialogue policy, and updating the recommender model based on user feedback. This work involves natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) techniques, which are commonly associated with the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category. The paper also deals with recommendation systems, which are typically associated with the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. The proposed framework involves learning a dialogue policy, which is a reinforcement learning problem, and updating the recommender model based on user feedback, which involves online learning techniques. These topics are commonly associated with the cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. Finally, the paper deals with the interaction between conversational and recommender systems, which is a topic that falls under the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-category.
